thread.title: Crystal Palace coach vandalised by mistake before Middlesbrough game
thread.title_full: Crystal Palace coach vandalised by mistake before Middlesbrough game

author: Ed Aarons
title: Crystal Palace coach vandalised by mistake before Middlesbrough game
text:
Crystal Palace coach vandalised by mistake before Middlesbrough game 
‚Ä¢ Palace had to arrange for replacement coach to take them to match ‚Ä¢ Vandals understood to have caused ¬£40,000 of graffiti damage Selhurst Park before Palace‚Äôs 1-0 win over Middlesbrough. Photograph: Alex Morton/Getty Images View more sharing options   11.16   11.18 GMT 
Crystal Palace were forced to arrange for a replacement coach to take them to Saturday‚Äôs Premier League victory over Middlesbrough after the original vehicle was vandalised outside the team hotel. 
The coach was daubed with ‚ÄòCrystal Palace FC‚Äô in red, white and blue paint across the sides and rear of the vehicle. The incident occurred hours before Palace secured a vital 1-0 win that lifted them out of the relegation zone. 
Palace confirmed on Sunday that the team‚Äôs coach had been vandalised. ‚ÄúThe team bus was covered in graffiti with the words ‚ÄòCrystal Palace‚Äô overnight on Friday ahead of the game,‚Äù a spokesman said. ‚ÄúPolice have been informed.‚Äù Rich Cook (@Rickyc1234) Palace fans vandalise what they think is the boro coach. But boro flew down and borrowed one of the palace coaches causing ¬£40k of damage üòÖüòÖ pic.twitter.com/SsXn6F6KoR February 26, 2017 
Palace‚Äôs assistant head groundsman Dean Waters also condemned the vandals and revealed that the coach could have been targeted because it was mistakenly believed to be taking the Middlesbrough team to Selhurst Park. 
‚Äú¬£40,000 worth of damage on our coach thinking it was the Boro coach. Nice one! #cpfc,‚Äù Waters tweeted, before changing his privacy settings so that the post was no longer available to the public.
